title: Labour Agreement visa (subclass 120)
summary: This page provides information about the Labour Agreement visa (subclass 120), which permanently closed to new applications on 1 July 2012. It outlines what the visa allowed, as well as obligations for visa holders and employers, and suggests an alternative visa option.

status.notes: This visa is closed to new applications.

structured_data.visa_description: A permanent residence visa that was previously available under a labour agreement.

permissions: apply for Australian citizenship if eligible
sponsor eligible relatives for permanent residence
travel to and from Australia for five years from the grant date (resident return visa or another visa required afterward)

visa_holder_obligations.entry_requirement: Must enter Australia by the date specified in the notification of grant letter.
employment_conditions: Do not have to work for the nominating employer
Must comply with employment contract obligations
Must comply with industrial laws requiring appropriate notice periods before stopping work

requirements: meet any additional requirements of the Labour Agreement
comply with all relevant Australian standards and workplace legislation for wages and working conditions

workplace_rights.reference: Workplace rights for all visa holders working in Australia
